item.title: Vanishing Act
item.description:
Playing as a witch stuck in your mansion as it is being raided by a demonic entity, gather the ingredients to perform a ritual to escape. Made by myself and a few friends for the AGDS Freshers Jam 2024.

I developed the event-based interaction and highlight system for interacting with the various puzzle elements of the game. I was also responsible for creating the character controller and ensuring the camera provides an adequate view of the scene without clipping through any walls.

I was also responsible for creating the quest system used to track the player’s progress in the ritual, ensuring the player had to perform the ritual steps in the correct order, and updating the displayed elements on the ritual table as appropriate.

Vanishing Act was my first project developed in Unreal Engine, and was programmed in C++.

item.title: Fishyphus
item.description:
A small game made by myself and a few friends for the 2 day long AGDS Halloween Jam 2024 made in the Unreal 5 Engine. Playing as the witch from Vanishing Act, and having successfully escaped the feds to your lakeside retreat, you are now on an eternal fishing holiday. My main contributions to this project were the bobbing of the fishing bobber, and the logic for when the player can catch a fish. weight = 40

Since the mechanics of the game were quite simple, we were able to spend a lot of time coming up with the various junk items the player could fish up and fill their cauldron with. It was a fun opportunity to put a lot of inside jokes from our friend group, along with references to popular memes of the time, into a game in such a way that would only be entertaining to ourselves.

Fishyphus was created in Unreal Engine 5, and programmed using C++ and Unreal Blueprint Visual Scripting.
